cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 115 miles south-southeast of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest today, then move northward, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and from Intracoastal City to Cameron; Tropical Storm Watch east of the Pearl River mouth to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas, and Intracoastal City to Cameron; Storm-Surge Warning Intracoastal City to Biloxi and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeast Louisiana coast, including the Mississippi River delta and adjacent Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with gusts near 60 mph possible Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor river surge possible but significant coastal surge expected farther south and in Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches likely with locally higher totals; threat of flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes starting Friday afternoon; prolonged high river levels on the Mississippi River impacting port operations
